definition: lit. looking up to it, it gets higher; boring into it, it gets harder (idiom) (from Analects)/fig. to delve deeply into one's studies/meticulous and diligent study
to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain
to face upward/to look up/to admire/to rely on
lit. to make night as day (idiom); fig. to burn the midnight oil/work especially hard
to grieve for the sick and the dying/to show great concern for people's suffering
to pore over a book/to look and admire
to study/to probe/to research and examine
to stand on tiptoe and crane one's neck (idiom); fig. to yearn for sth
to have a wide knowledge of many subjects (idiom)
lit. to live on dry provisions and wild herbs (idiom)/fig. to live in abject poverty
to live in luxury/lit. to ride a solid carriage pulled by fat horses
expert craft from hard practice (idiom); hard-won skill/A masterpiece demands suffering.
